program_name: Master of Engineering (MEng) in Systems Design Engineering

level_constraints.description: At most 2 courses at the 500 level may be counted towards the degree.

departmental_constraints.description: At least 2 Systems Design Engineering courses at the 500, 600 or 700 level.

requirements.description: Core systems theory course: SYDE 600 Systems Theory, Models, Research & Design
Systems Design Graduate Workshop 1 - Choose one workshop variant based on specialization or general workshop
6 Engineering graduate courses (0.50 unit weight per course) counting towards degree credit from the University of Waterloo. Must satisfy level and departmental constraints.

specializations.name: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
specializations.description: A Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with a mix of specified and elective courses.

requirements.description: Required: SYDE 660A Systems Design Graduate Workshop 1 – AI and Machine Learning
AI Foundations: Choose 1 from SYDE 522 Machine Intelligence or SYDE 552 Computational Neurosciences
AI Electives: Choose at least 1 from the following list

specializations.name: Biomedical Systems
specializations.description: A Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with a mix of specified and elective courses.

requirements.description: Required: SYDE 660B Systems Design Graduate Workshop 1 – Biomedical Systems

Choose at least 2 from: SYDE 544 Biomed Measure & SIP, SYDE 684 Materials Biocompatability, SYDE 750 Topic 20 Topics in Systems Modelling: Modeling of Biomechanical Systems, SYDE 750 Topic 36 Topics in Systems Modelling: Assistive Tech and Rehab Eng

Biomedical Electives: Choose at least 1 from the following list or an additional course from the Specified course list. Note: only one 500 level course may be used to satisfy the requirements of a Graduate Specialization.

specializations.name: Human Factors
specializations.description: A Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with a mix of specified and elective courses.

requirements.description: Required: SYDE 660C Systems Design Graduate Workshop 1 – Human Factors
Choose at least 2 from: SYDE 542 Interface Design or SYDE 543 Cognitive Ergonomics, SYDE 642 Cognitive Engineering Methods, SYDE 644 Human Factors Testing

Human Factors Electives: Choose at least 1 from the following list or an additional course from the Specified course list. Note: only one 500 level course may be used to satisfy the requirements of a Graduate Specialization.

specializations.name: Mechatronic and Physical Systems
specializations.description: A Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with a mix of specified and elective courses.

requirements.description: Required: SYDE 660D Systems Design Graduate Workshop 1 - Mechatronic & Physical Systems

Choose at least 2 from: SYDE 553 Advanced Dynamics, SYDE 652 Dynamics of Multibody Systems, SYDE 655 Optimal Control, SYDE 682 Advanced MEMS Physics Design & Fabrication, SYDE 683 Modelling Simulation & Design of MEMS, SYDE 750 Modelling Continuum Systems

Mechatronics Electives: Choose at least 1 from the following list or an additional course from the Specified course list. Note: only one 500 level course may be used to satisfy the requirements of a Graduate Specialization.

specializations.name: Vision, Image and Signal Processing
specializations.description: A Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with a mix of specified and elective courses.

requirements.description: Required: SYDE 660E Systems Design Graduate Workshop 1 - Vision, Image & Signal Processing
Choose at least 2 from: SYDE 575 Image Processing, SYDE 671 Advanced Image Processing, SYDE 677 Medical Imaging

Vision Electives: Choose at least 1 from the following list or an additional course from the Specified course list. Note: only one 500 level course may be used to satisfy the requirements of a Graduate Specialization.

graduate_aim.description: Students must complete the Graduate Academic Integrity Module (Graduate AIM) in addition to course requirements.

specialization_notes: A Graduate Specialization is a University credential that is recognized on the student's transcript but not on the diploma.

A student will only obtain the Graduate Specialization on their transcript if they have completed the requirements associated with the MEng degree and the requirements associated with the Graduate Specialization.
All MEng Graduate Specializations in Systems Design Engineering consist of a set of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses.
All course selections are arranged by the student.
These requirements are in addition to satisfactory completion of any transitional courses that may be specified at the time of admission.
additional_requirements.level_constraint_note: Note that only one 500 level course may be used to satisfy the requirements of a Graduate Specialization for most specializations.
